>  You are confusing the "ordering doesn't matter"
> property of various methods on an object - ie, that each ordering
> makes sense from that object's viewpoint, no order is more "right"
> than another - with the "ordering matters" viewpoint of the *user*
> of that object desiring a *specific effect*.
That's what I thought too.
